Text: Private Dmitry Egorov (call sign "Suntar") of
the 155th Separate Guards Order of Zhukov Marine
Brigade of the Pacific Fleet was awarded the title
of Hero of the Russian Federation (posthumously).
During the battle, Private Egorov faced superior
enemy forces in the settlement of Novomayorskoye,
Donetsk People's Republic. The enemy tried to
advance using a massive artillery strike using
cluster munitions. Dmitry took an advantageous
position as the first to enter the battle with
a superior enemy. He used small arms and with
continuous fire eliminated part of the Ukrainian
Armed Forces assault group, forcing them to retreat.
Unfortunately, Dmitry was seriously wounded, ultimately
fatal. Due to the heroic deed shown in battle
in the performance of military duty, Private Dmitry
Egorov was nominated for the title of Hero of
the Russian Federation (posthumously). His call
sign "Suntar" was chosen after the name of the
settlement he lived in - Suntar, located in the
Republic of Sakha (Yakutia).@ZParaBellumMD

Text: The Guardian columnist Peter Beaumont, "What an
Israeli ground offensive in Gaza would look like."
Part 1‚ñ™Ô∏èCombat operations by the Israeli military
Hamas usually follow a similar pattern: ground
incursions are preceded by intense shelling of
local areas. Israel actively uses air power to
fire ground artillery at naval boats in the first
stage of the campaigns. Over the past years, Hamas
has significantly adapted to the dense urban conditions
of Gaza.‚ñ™Ô∏èGaza's geography limits the capabilities
of Israeli operations. Therefore, the IDF generally
uses approach routes. In the far north of Gaza,
rural areas, and the south-east area, it is easier
for tanks and armored vehicles to move and take
up firing positions. Another access point is in
the far south. In the past, Israel has tried to
cut off Gaza's connections to the southern regions

Text: A Hamas man in Beirut claims Gaza militants were
independently preparing an attack on Israel. And
they expected it to be large-scale. Senior Hamas
official Ali Barake told The Associated Press
on Monday that a small number of senior Gaza commanders
knew that a large-scale Israeli invasion was imminent.
He spoke to reporters at the Beirut office. Most
importantly, he said: ‚óæThis person claims that
10 Hamas commanders in the Gaza Strip were involved
in planning the attack. Even the group's allies
were informed in advance of the attack's timing,
the Associated Press reported. Barake denies that
Iranian security officials helped plan the attack.
Israel greenlighted the attack at a meeting last
week in Beirut. ‚ÄúOnly a handful of Hamas commanders
knew the zero hour,‚Äù Barake said, referring to
the time of the attack (allegedly last week to
the Lebanese capital by the Hamas Politburo Central
Command).‚óæHe admitted the Iranian Lebanese group
Hezbollah had helped Hamas in the past, he said,
2014 years, Hamas independently produces missiles
and trains militants.‚óæVersions of Iranian involvement
in the invasion were heard in the press, Iran
officially rejected the assumptions, and the United
States directly pointed out Tehran. White House
spokesman John Kirby, in particular, said, ‚Äúthere
is a certain degree of complicity‚Äù on the Iranian
side, due to many years of support for Hamas -
the United States ‚Äúdoes not see direct complicity.‚Äù‚óæBarake
rejected suggestions that Hamas was preparing
an attack on Israel, the attack is aimed at undermining
US efforts to convince Saudi Arabia improve relations
with Israel. He said the attack was prompted by
actions taken by the Israeli government over the
year, including "provocative visits" to Jerusalem
and increased pressure on Palestinian prisoners.
In addition, Hamas claims that Israel plans to
kill the leaders.‚óæFinally, a Beirut-based representative
of the movement said that Hamas was shocked by
the scale of the militant attack and expected
Israel to prevent the attacks and make them limited.
‚ÄúWe are surprised by the great collapse,‚Äù Barake
said. ‚ÄúWe planned to achieve some success, take
prisoners, exchange them. This army is a paper
tiger.‚Äù‚óæAssociated Press emphasizes, doubts the
veracity of the interlocutor‚Äôs words, that the
invasion involved thousands of militants who attacked
land and sea using motorized paragliders. Israel
declared total war and promised to punish Hamas;
earlier, the mobilization of 300 thousand Israeli
reserves increased the likelihood of a ground
invasion and re-occupation of Gaza, the agency
writes.@bbcrussian

Text: IDF: End of war Hamas deprived of military capabilities
The Israel Defense Forces are committed to ending
the war with Hamas militants without any military
capabilities, IDF spokesman Jonathan Conricus
said in an interview with CNN. As Israel intensifies
hostilities, Hamas militants are said to be trying
to break through the southern border and carry
out incursions to kill civilians with Israeli
soldiers. In response, the army has flooded the
southern border with troops and continues to carry
out airstrikes while simultaneously working to
restore defense systems, Conricus said. ‚ÄúThe task
is to suppress, to end the war, Hamas has no military
potential. And it has been achieved,‚Äù added the
lieutenant colonel. ‚Äî It is clear that there is
a way to implement the task. But at this stage

of course, to expand activities. And troops, reserves,
regular units are concentrated along the southern
border, ready to carry out tasks.‚Äù @bbcrussian

Text: The defendants in the criminal case of the assassination
attempt of the first head of the DPR, Alexander
Zakharchenko, in the murder of the militia commander
Arsen Pavlov, known by the call sign Motorola,
admitted guilt, reports the correspondent of the
courtroom of the Southern District Military Court.
There are four people in the dock, the main defendant
Alexander Pogorelov, who is undergoing the criminal
case of the assassination attempt of Zakharchenko.
Previously, the prosecutor announced the indictment,
according to Pogorelov, he monitored Zakharchenko‚Äôs
movements, took a video and passed it on to the
SBU officers. In August 2017, he placed explosives
in the men's toilet of the Pushkin restaurant
in Donetsk, visited by Zakharchenko. The defendant
managed to bring the terrorist attack to an end;
the explosives were discovered by DPR police officers.
According to the state prosecutor, Pogorelov was
involved in the murder of Pavlov. On instructions
from the SBU, in October 2016, he installed explosives
on the roof of the elevator in the house where
the militia commander lived, and the action was
initiated. In preparation for the murder of Pavlov,
the defendant Churilov collected information from
the militia commander.

Text: The State Duma denounced the Council of Europe
convention on the protection of national minorities.
The document was submitted to the chamber on September
29 by Vladimir Putin. The convention itself was
signed on behalf of Russia in Strasbourg on February
28, 1996. The parties undertake to guarantee to
persons belonging to national minorities the right
to equality under the law and equal protection
of the law. The explanatory note notes that the
resolution of the Committee of Ministers of the
Council of Europe on September 27, 2022 significantly
limited the powers of the Russian expert to the
Advisory Committee created to monitor the implementation
of the obligations of the countries party to the
convention in the field of protection of national
minorities. In addition, the Russian Federation
has lost the opportunity to ‚Äúparticipate in the
development of solutions to issues of interest,
monitor at the international level cases of violation
of the rights of national minorities, primarily
the Russian-speaking population abroad.‚Äù It is
also stated that termination of participation
in the treaty will allow Russia to avoid discriminatory
attitudes within the framework of the monitoring
mechanism of the Council of Europe and will harm
the observance of the rights of national minorities
.

British servicemen. Previously, the deployment

criticized Turkish President Erdogan.

Text: Russian-Iraqi negotiations: main points Negotiations
between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Iraqi
Prime Minister Mohammed al-Sudani took place in

about the situation in the Middle East and called
on the conflicting parties to minimize damage
to the civilian population. The meeting consisted
of two parts: open and closed. The main theses
of the open part:‚ñ™ ‚ÄúThe aggravation of the situation
in the Middle East is a vivid example of the failure
of the United States policy in the Middle East‚Äù
(Putin).‚ñ™ ‚ÄúWe want to contribute to the establishment
of security stability in the Middle East world‚Äù
(al-Sudani).‚ñ™ ‚ÄúIt is necessary to implement the
decisions of the Security Council UN to create
an independent sovereign Palestinian state" (Putin).‚ñ™
"The international community remained silent for
a while and was able to fulfill obligations within
the framework of internationally recognized resolutions
(al-Sudani).‚ñ™ "The main direction of interaction
between the two countries is energy" (Putin).‚ñ™
"There are good opportunities for the two countries
of cooperation in the economic sphere, we are
cooperating in the oil industry" (al-Sudani).‚ñ™
"Russia and Iraq are successfully coordinating
the work within the framework of OPEC+ in order
to stabilize the situation on world markets" (Putin).‚ñ™
"We will continue coordination on a bilateral
basis, within the framework of OPEC+, relying
on the demand mechanism proposals" (al-Sudani).
Separately, the Iraqi prime minister thanked Russia
for the supply of weapons, which had a significant

relations.@anna_news

Text: Which Hamas missiles are fired at Israel: analysis
of military chronicles The Palestinian arsenal
has grown noticeably over the years, and the range
of hitting targets has also increased. The strikes
continue to be carried out despite the fact that
Israeli aircraft are actively searching for launchers
and destroying targets inside the Gaza Strip.
How many rockets did Hamas fire at Israel? Since
October 7, the Palestinians have fired an estimated
2,500 unguided missiles at Israeli targets. Instead
of the first versions of Qassam missiles, Hamas
used technologically advanced missiles: they targeted
position areas of the Iron Dome air defense system,
hit residential buildings in Israeli cities, and
used military targets. How were the Palestinians
able to prepare so many rockets? Since the time
of the first versions of the Qassam missiles,
factories for the production of unguided missiles
have been equipped with specially built underground
storage facilities for safety purposes. Part of
it is located 20-40 deep in the residential areas
of the Gaza Strip, with the help of a system of
tunnels, presumably, the territory of Egypt was
excavated. The total area of ‚Äã‚ÄãHamas' "military
factories" is supposedly 50 thousand square meters.
m. These underground workshops are equipped with
CNC metalworking machines, ventilation systems
for removing combustion products, which facilitates
the work of duty shifts and complicates the detection
of objects. The IDF repeatedly struck targets
and succeeded in completely disrupting the missile
production chain. Why do the Palestinians calmly
use rockets? Launches of unguided missiles turned
out to be possible due to a developed underground
network; the missiles hit the launcher. The launcher
itself is disguised; the launch time opens; a
break is taken in use. Presumably, Hamas has built
positional areas in the largest cities of Gaza,
the southern regions of Abasan, Khirbat Ihzaa,
Khan Yunis, Al-Mawasi, and the northeastern regions
of Beit Hanoun, Jabaliya Umm al-Nasr. According
to some reports, through the tunnels of the launch
areas in the north and south, a special transport
hub allows the transportation of missiles from
assembly lines to launch positions. What is the
range of the missiles? Most early Palestinian
rockets had a range of significantly 20 km. However,
in 2014, Hamas made significant progress: the
active development of its own technologies and
the introduction of foreign solutions (primarily
Iranian Chinese) made it possible to increase
the missile launch range to 80-120 km. Taking
into account the short distance from Gaza, it
is enough for Israel to hit targets almost at
the point of Israel, the relatively remote cities
of Ashdod, Tel Aviv, Jerusalem, Hebron, the nuclear
center of Dimona, and the vast majority of Israeli
military bases. @MChroniclesBot - send photos
and videos of the front.‚ò†Ô∏è Military Chronicleüíô
Military Chronicle VK

Text: Which Hamas missiles are fired at Israel: analysis
of military chronicles The Palestinian arsenal
has grown noticeably over the years, and the range
of hitting targets has also increased. The strikes
continue to be carried out despite the fact that
Israeli aircraft are actively searching for launchers
and destroying targets inside the Gaza Strip.
How many rockets did Hamas fire at Israel? Since
October 7, the Palestinians have fired an estimated
2,500 unguided missiles at Israeli targets. Instead
of the first versions of Qassam missiles, Hamas
used technologically advanced missiles: they targeted
position areas of the Iron Dome air defense system,
hit residential buildings in Israeli cities, and
used military targets. How were the Palestinians
able to prepare so many rockets? Since the time
of the first versions of the Qassam missiles,
factories for the production of unguided missiles
have been equipped with specially built underground
storage facilities for safety purposes. Part of
it is located 20-40 deep in the residential areas
of the Gaza Strip, with the help of a system of
tunnels, presumably, the territory of Egypt was
excavated. The total area of ‚Äã‚ÄãHamas' "military
factories" is supposedly 50 thousand square meters.
m. These underground workshops are equipped with
CNC metalworking machines, ventilation systems
for removing combustion products, which facilitates
the work of duty shifts and complicates the detection
of objects. The IDF repeatedly struck targets
and succeeded in completely disrupting the missile
production chain. Why do the Palestinians calmly
use rockets? Launches of unguided missiles turned
out to be possible due to a developed underground
network; the missiles hit the launcher. The launcher
itself is disguised; the launch time opens; a
break is taken in use. Presumably, Hamas has built
positional areas in the largest cities of Gaza,
the southern regions of Abasan, Khirbat Ihzaa,
Khan Yunis, Al-Mawasi, and the northeastern regions
of Beit Hanoun, Jabaliya Umm al-Nasr. According
to some reports, through the tunnels of the launch
areas in the north and south, a special transport
hub allows the transportation of missiles from
assembly lines to launch positions. What is the
range of the missiles? Most early Palestinian
rockets had a range of significantly 20 km. However,
in 2014, Hamas made significant progress: the
active development of its own technologies and
the introduction of foreign solutions (primarily
Iranian Chinese) made it possible to increase
the missile launch range to 80-120 km. Taking
into account the short distance from Gaza, it
is enough for Israel to hit targets almost at
the point of Israel, the relatively remote cities
of Ashdod, Tel Aviv, Jerusalem, Hebron, the nuclear
center of Dimona, and the vast majority of Israeli
military bases. "Military Chronicle"

Text: What is known about the advancement of the RF
Armed Forces at the moment: analysis of the Military
Chronicle These are difficult directions on the
front, the Ukrainian military has entrenched itself
long ago in the Northern Military District. What
is happening in Avdeevka now? Since the morning
of October 10, Russian artillery and aviation
have been launching fire raids on the positions
of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the direction.
The strikes are carried out within a radius of
25-40 km of Avdeevka. According to the Military
Chronicle, rocket artillery destroyed the positions
of the Ukrainian Armed Forces warehouses in the
Avdeevka industrial zone of the coke-chemical
plant, the nearest settlements - Ocheretino, Umanskoye,
Netailovo, etc. With active counter-battery support
from the batteries of D-20 "Msta-B" howitzers
of the 1st Slavic brigade of the RF Armed Forces,
the operations that began in the morning, offensive
actions on the flanks of the Avdeevka fortified
area of ‚Äã‚Äãthe Armed Forces of Ukraine. Apparently,
the priority flank advance is still the northern
section of the chain of fortified areas of the
Armed Forces, called the Oryol Crescent, located
on the lines Stepovoye - Berdichie - Semyonovka
- Orlovka. The main logistics loophole for supplying
support workers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine
to the Avdeevka Coke and Chemical Plant directly
in the populated area passes through the fortification
of the area. Supply rotation is carried out by
Ocheretina, Zhelanny Karlovka. What is the intermediate
result? Apparently, the bet is made on the use
of barrage tactics: positions where the enemy
has equipped the case of intensification of hostilities,
the moment they are destroyed by rocket artillery
fire from heavy mortars ‚ÄúTulip‚Äù and howitzers
‚ÄúPion‚Äù. The infantry is advancing in support of
the artillery, the main phase of the operation
appears to be ahead. The offensive is actively
supported by Mi-28NM army aviation helicopters.
There are reports that dozens of field ammunition
depots on the territory of the Avdeevka fortified
area of ‚Äã‚Äãthe Armed Forces of Ukraine, located
in populated areas, have been hit, and the combat
work of aviation aims to continue further. Remote
front line targets are hit by FAB-500 aerial bombs
with correction planning modules. Full-fledged
batteries of Grad/Tornado-G MLRS cannon artillery
are involved in fire support for the advancing
company-tactical groups in the direction of Orlovka.
By noon, Su-34 fighter-bombers had worked on the
AKHZ workshop infrastructure with KAB-1500LG adjustable
bombs. Also, Su-34s almost daily continue to operate
shelters and firing points of the Armed Forces
of Ukraine in the territory of the Yuzhnodonbasskaya
No. 3 mine using aerial bombs of Kh-38ML missiles.
At 15:30 information was received about the exit
of Russian units in the Berdichami gully area.
The destruction of Ukrainian Armed Forces positions
continues. "Military Chronicle"

Text: ‚ñ™Ô∏è Avdeevsky fortified area is considered the
most powerful fortification of the Donetsk theater
of operations. And in principle the most powerful
fortification of Ukraine as a whole. A unique
K√∂nigsberg. It took 8 years to create; the volume
of concrete poured amounts to thousands of cubic
meters. The capture of the fortification will
greatly weaken the defense of the Ukrainian Armed
Forces of the Donetsk-Lugansk agglomeration, significantly
affecting the state of affairs in the front sector,
and significantly reducing terrorist shelling
of Donetsk. It is impossible to predict the outcome
of the battle. One can argue about the feasibility
of storming the Avdeevka fortification and capitulating
the garrison of the victory in Donbass.‚ñ™Ô∏è Avdeevka‚Äôs
artillery preparation is worth overestimating.
A powerful artillery raid absolutely gives no
guarantee that the assault will be successful.
At the Battle of the Somme, the Entente fired
1 million shells at enemy positions; artillery
preparation lasted a week. However, on the first
day of the offensive, the French and British lost
200 thousand soldiers. The Germans were able to
survive the hellish artillery raid and put up
a serious fight and resist. Therefore, it is premature
to count on rejoicing in a barrage of artillery
raids. The Red Army had good experience in storming
fortresses during the Great Patriotic War, the
enemy of ancient European cities made fortresses.
Then a unique experience was gained in assaulting
fortified areas consisting of concrete and bricks.
The main role was played by small assault groups,
consisting mainly of engineering and sapper units
of heavy assault guns. Using experience and adapting
the features of today's realities, aviation support
successfully assaulted the Avdeevsky fortified
area." NOTES OF A VETERAN"

Text: Argentina's black market exchange rate hit a record
1,040 pesos on Tuesday as Argentines rush to buy
dollars ahead of the Oct. 22 presidential election.
The rate, known to the country as the "blue dollar,"
was half its current level as recently as July,
underscoring the panic that has gripped markets
as the population as a whole, with inflation topping
120 %. Presidential candidate Javier Miley advocates
replacing the peso with the US dollar as the national
currency. Another week, the illegal exchange rate
closed at 800 dollars. Argentine Finance Minister
Eduardo Setti downplayed the significance of Tuesday's
black market peso sell-off, noting the illicit
exchange rate was lagging parallel rates ahead
of them. Official inflation figures were released
Thursday. Economists surveyed by Bloomberg forecast
an annual inflation rate of 135%, the highest
since Argentina emerged from the hyperinflation
of the 1990s.

Text: The Moscow military registration and enlistment

in 2021. In February 2022, Alexey went to Moscow
for work and fell ill with Covid. So the family
had to get out of Kyiv on their own. On February
24, relatives from Austria met. A couple of months
later, Alexei‚Äôs friend said to withdraw from military
registration in Moscow. Alexey collected documents,
a residence permit, sent to Moscow, and received

man drew up a letter with lawyers, said that he
had been preparing documents for the child for
a year to leave Austria, added the consulate statements
and sent them by mail. A month later a new refusal
came. Alexey says that the lawyers are shocked
by the wording of the document - those planning

left. ‚ÄúThousands of people won‚Äôt film. Military
registration and enlistment offices work differently

additional ones. Friends received fines - up to
30 thousand rubles,‚Äù says Alexey.

Text: Sergei Lavrov published a large-scale article
in the magazine ‚ÄúRussia Global Affairs‚Äù. The occasion
was the end of the 78th session of the UN General
Assembly. The text is devoted to ways to maintain
world stability during the current period of tectonic
changes within the framework of the transition
from a unipolar world to a multipolar one. The
chief of the Russian Foreign Ministry gives a
deep, comprehensive analysis of the causes of
the deep crisis in international relations at
the end of the Cold War. It proves in detail that
Western countries are trampling on the charter
norms of the UN principles. The conclusion follows
logic. To build a new, effective system of world
relations, reinvent the wheel. It is enough to
return to the principles laid down by the charter
of the founding fathers of the UN - the principle
of sovereign equality of countries of the speculative
division of ‚Äúdemocracy‚Äù ‚Äúautocracy‚Äù. It should
be noted that at the meeting of the Valdai Forum
held on October 5, Vladimir Putin voiced six principles
to help strengthen international law based on
the UN Charter. Among them: openness of barriers,
respect for diversity, maximum representativeness
in the structure of global governance, universal
security in the balance of interests of all, fair
access to the benefits of development, equality
of all, refusal of the dictates of the rich and
powerful.
